page.title: 01GENERAL OVERVIEW
page.content: {The area is mainly farmland, with a {dozen farms mainly engaged in the {Dairy industry, but with some sheep {and beef cattle. There are patches of {mainly deciduous woodland. The River {Torridge runs down the centre, with {its tributary, the Waldon crossing the {south west corner of the grid. Much of {the land is pasture and riverside {meadow, the grass crops being gathered {as hay and silage. Arable crops are {grown mainly for cattle feed. At the {eastern side of the grid is part of {the village of Shebbear, with part of {the smaller village of Thornbury in {the west. The majority of the roads {are narrow with high banks and hedges. {Shebbear is a village centre {supplying educational, medical, {garaging, and to a lesser extent {shopping services }
